p: Coronaviruses (CoV) are enveloped, positive-sense RNA viruses of the order Nidovirales, with genome sizes ranging from 26 to 32 kilobases ( Gorbalenya et al., 2006). They have been identified across a range of avian and mammalian hosts, but did not attract much attention until November 2002, with the emergence of severe acute respiratory syndrome CoV (SARS-CoV) from Guangdong in southern China ( Peiris et al., 2003), resulting in over 8000 human infections and 774 deaths across 37 countries. In September 2012, a second human pathogen: middle-east respiratory syndrome CoV (MERS-CoV), emerged in Saudi Arabia ( Zaki et al., 2012), causing 2494 confirmed cases of infection with 858 deaths, a case fatality rate of >34%.
